title: Twmbarlwm Walking Route

images.title: Jonathan Billinger / Looking towards Twmbarlwm
images.caption: Looking towards Twmbarlwm. The hill fort in the distance is on the other side of the Sirhowy valley. The pasture is north of the lane which ascends the ridge north-west of Machen.

images.title: Roger Cornfoot / Path to the summit of Twmbarlwm
images.caption: Path to the summit of Twmbarlwm

images.title: Sheila Khan / Looking East from the summit of Twmbarlwm
images.caption: Looking East from the summit of Twmbarlwm

images.title: Roger Cornfoot / Close up of Hill Fort, on Twmbarlwm
images.caption: Close up of Hill Fort, on Twmbarlwm

images.title: Rudi Winter / View from Twmbarlwm summit
images.caption: View from Twmbarlwm summit. The Bristol Channel / Mor Hafren from the top of Twmbarlwm (88185). The two Severn motorway bridges can be seen in the centre (M4, 3351) and far left (M48, 3344).

description: This circular walk climbs to Twmbarlwm hill fort, near Risca in South Wales. It's a well known local landmark that is also known as Twm Barlwm, Twyn Barlwm or "the Twmp" (the Pimple). You can start the walk from the parking area, located just to the west of the hill on Cwmcarn Forest Forest Drive. From here it is a short climb to the summit of the hill which stands at a height of 419 m (1,375 ft). Here you'll find the remains of an Iron Age Hillfort and superb views over South Wales to the Bristol Channel. It's a lovely area with a series of footpaths and steps to explore the hill fort on. After taking in the views the route descends through the woodland surrounding the hill before picking up a section of the Raven Walk to take you back to the parking area. The route could also be started from the Cwmcarn Forest Visitor Centre which is only a short distance from the hill.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area just head into Risca where you can pick up the Monmouthshire and Brecon Canal. There's easy waterside walking along the towpath which you could follow into Newport.

display_address: Cwmcarn Forest Drive, Risca West, Pont-y-waun, Crosskeys, Caerphilly, Cymru / Wales, NP11 7FA, United Kingdom
